title_sort: walt whitman to louisa van velsor whitman, 17 february [1873]
title: Walt Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 17 February [1873]
text: Monday afternoon—Feb. 17 ½ past 3Dearest mother,I have been down stairs, & out on the street this afternoon—it is such fine weather, (after the bad storm of yesterday)—I got along very slowly, & didn't go far—but it was a great thing after being kept in for over three weeks—I rec'd a short letter from Jeff again to-day, dated 13th—nothing different with Mat—I rec'd your letter Saturday—I hope now to improve in walking—& then I shall begin to feel all right—(but am still very feeble & slow)—Peter Doyle & another friend accompanied me out—Dear Mother, I hope this will find you feeling well—Love to all—Walt. Walt Whitman to Louisa Van Velsor Whitman, 17 February [1873]
